title: Juan de Albi
text: Juan de Albi was a Spanish <a href="Carthusian">Carthusian</a> of the Convent Val-Christ, near <a href="Segovia">Segovia</a>, date of birth uncertain; died 27 December 1591. He was familiar with the Oriental languages, especially Hebrew, and had the reputation of being a skilled commentator. His work is: "Sacrarum semioseon, animadversionum et electorum ex utriusque Testamenti lectione commentarius et centuria" (<a href="Valencia%20%28city%20in%20Spain%29">Valencia</a>, 1610); it was re-edited in <a href="Venice">Venice</a>, 1613, under the title "Selectæ Annotationes in varia utriusque Testamenti loca difficiliora."
